Title: Subcortical afferent connections of the amygdala in the monkey

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation: "The "centralis" nuclear complex, according to Olszewski's ('52) observations, is a cytologically heterogeneous group of midline nuclei interposed vertically between the nucleus paraventricularis (PA) and nucleus reuniens  above the third ventricle. The pars densocellularis surrounds the middle of the nucleus anterior medialis just ventral to the anterior part of PA (Fig. 4, 5, 11). It is composed of densely packed, round cells."

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The "centralis" nuclear complex, according to Olszewski's ('52) observations, is a ccytologically heterogeneous group of midline nuclei interposed vertically between the nucleus paraventricularis (PA) and the nucleus reuniens above thhe third ventricle... pars densocellularis... pars latocellularis (Clc)... pars intermedialis (Cim)... nucleus centralis inferior (Cif)..."

"The "centralis" nuclear complex, according to Olszewski's ('52) observations, is a ccytologically heterogeneous group of midline nuclei interposed vertically between the nucleus paraventricularis (PA) and the nucleus reuniens above thhe third ventricle... pars densocellularis... pars latocellularis (Clc)... pars intermedialis (Cim)... nucleus centralis inferior (Cif)..."

"The "centralis" nuclear complex, according to Olszewski's ('52) observations, is a ccytologically heterogeneous group of midline nuclei interposed vertically between the nucleus paraventricularis (PA) and the nucleus reuniens above thhe third ventricle... pars densocellularis... pars latocellularis (Clc)... pars intermedialis (Cim)... nucleus centralis inferior (Cif)..."

"The "centralis" nuclear complex, according to Olszewski's ('52) observations, is a ccytologically heterogeneous group of midline nuclei interposed vertically between the nucleus paraventricularis (PA) and the nucleus reuniens above thhe third ventricle... pars densocellularis... pars latocellularis (Clc)... pars intermedialis (Cim)... nucleus centralis inferior (Cif)..."

"Labeled cells in a region lateral to the caudal aspectof the nucleus reuniens (Re), dorsal to the subparafascicularis nuclei (sPF), and just in front of the centromedian -parafascicularis complex (CM-Pf), have been identified as constituents of the nucleus interventralis (IV) (Rioch, '29; Aronson and Papez, '34; Krieg, '48)."

"This nucleus [subparafscicularis] was precisely defined as to position and named by Rioch ('29) in the dog. He noted that it was intercalated in the external medullary lamina, ventral to the parafscicular nucleus (as we have also in the monkey), not under the habenulo-interpedincular "fascicles", as implied by Aronson and Papez's ('34) misnomer, "subfascicularis," also used by Olszewski ('52). Correcting for this terminological oversight, we have adopted in the present study Olszewski's division of the subparafascicularis (sPf) into (1) a ... parvicellular (pc) part and (2) a ... "magnocellular," (mc) part... The most caudolateral part of the sPFpc plate of the present study appears to be included in the dorsal part of the region labeled "tegmental area" by Olszewski ('52)."
"The most caudolateral part of the sPFpc plate of the present study appears to be included in the dorsal part of the region labeled "tegmental area" by Olszewski ('52)."
@InterMapRelations.Comments: O52 does not delineate a tegmental area, but a Nucleus tegmentalis anterior (Teg.a), which is situated adjoining to the Sf.pc in plate XXVIII.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "In the macaque, Olszewski ('52) designates as Re a rather wide region dorsal to the third ventricle, extending from the oral almost to the caudal end of the massa intermedia. In all our monkeys slender column of HRP-labelled cells consistently onnly at the ventrolateral edge of the region included under the label Re. Since no HRP-positive cells have ever appeared in other parts of Re in our material, we have named this HRP labeled entity reuniens ventralis (Rv)..."

"In the macaque, Olszewski ('52) designates as Re a rather wide region dorsal to the third ventricle, extending from the oral almost to the caudal end of the massa intermedia. In all our monkeys slender column of HRP-labelled cells consistently onnly at the ventrolateral edge of the region included under the label Re. Since no HRP-positive cells have ever appeared in other parts of Re in our material, we have named this HRP labeled entity reuniens ventralis (Rv)..."

"Olszewski's ('52) atlas shows that its IV nuclear area coincides with the basal, medium-sized cell region lying between Re and ventralis posterior inferior in Plate 20. Olszewski includes this region within the ventromedial territorial boundaries of the nebulous pars oralis, ventralis posterior lateralis (VPLo), althoough both myelo- and cytoarchitectural features suggesting separation of this area from VPLo are evident in his Plate 20."

"This nucleus [subparafscicularis] was precisely defined as to position and named by Rioch ('29) in the dog. He noted that it was intercalated in the external medullary lamina, ventral to the parafscicular nucleus (as we have also in the monkey), not under the habenulo-interpedincular "fascicles", as implied by Aronson and Papez's ('34) misnomer, "subfascicularis," also used by Olszewski ('52)."

"This nucleus [subparafscicularis] was precisely defined as to position and named by Rioch ('29) in the dog. He noted that it was intercalated in the external medullary lamina, ventral to the parafscicular nucleus (as we have also in the monkey), not under the habenulo-interpedincular "fascicles", as implied by Aronson and Papez's ('34) misnomer, "subfascicularis," also used by Olszewski ('52). Correcting for this terminological oversight, we have adopted in the present study Olszewski's division of the subparafascicularis (sPf) into (1) a ... parvicellular (pc) part and (2) a ... "magnocellular," (mc) part..."
"... the anterior, middle, and posterior parts of the nucleus paraventricularis thalami (PA) project to the amygdala..."
"... the anterior, middle, and posterior parts of the nucleus paraventricularis thalami (PA) project to the amygdala..."
"... the anterior, middle, and posterior parts of the nucleus paraventricularis thalami (PA) project to the amygdala..."
"... we adopted Olszewski's division of subparafascicularis (sPF) into (1) a large, flat, caudolateral parvicellular (pc) part, and (2) a smaller, cylindrical, oral-medial "magnocellular" (mc) part."
"... we adopted Olszewski's division of subparafascicularis (sPF) into (1) a large, flat, caudolateral parvicellular (pc) part, and (2) a smaller, cylindrical, oral-medial "magnocellular" (mc) part."
